Description: Weight: fals weight of 30 kharrūba. Nine line Kufic inscription with six pointed star at top. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: From the same die: Launois, Aimée. 1957. Estampilles et poids faibles en verre Omeyyades et Abbasides au Musée Arabe du Caire, ‘Mélanges islamologiques’ III, 92; Fahmi, A. 1957. ‘Sinaj al-sikka fī fajr al-Islām’. Cairo, 61. Cf. Launois 1957, 93; Fahmi 1957, 62.

Fahmi notes that 'ibn' (son) is omitted between the names of Muslim and his father. The specimens of this type are the only stamps of Muslim so far known dated 121. On others, where the date is clear it is 119 and in most other cases certainly to be read 119. Bibliography: Fahmi, A. 1957. ‘Sinaj al-sikka fī fajr al-Islām’. Cairo.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (82)
Associated names: Named in inscription: Muslim b. al-'Arrāf
